row.name: release_channel
row.inlineHelp:
While our development process includes thousands of automated tests, Beta Testers play a key role in achieving the "No bug policy" in Matomo.
If Matomo is a critical part of your business, we recommend you use the latest stable release. If you use the latest beta and you find a bug or have a suggestion, please see here.
LTS (Long Term Support) versions receive only security and bug fixes.

row.name: enable_plugin_update_communication
row.inlineHelp: An email will be sent to Super Users when there is a new version available for a plugin.
row.introduction: Send an email when a plugin update is available

row.name: metric
row.title: Metric to display
row.description: Choose the metric that should be displayed in the browser tab

row.name: browsers
row.title: Supported Browsers
row.description: The value will be only displayed in the following browsers

row.name: description
row.title: Description for value
row.value: This is the value: Another line
row.defaultValue: This is the value: Another line
row.description: This description will be displayed next to the value

row.name: password
row.title: API password
row.description: Password for the 3rd API where we fetch the value

row.name: canUserOptOut
row.title: Let users disable anonymous tracking
row.description: If enabled, logged in users can opt out in their plugin settings. Anonymous users cannot opt out.

row.name: trackToPiwik
row.title: Send usage data to Matomo.org
row.description: If enabled, anonymized usage data will be sent to demo-anonymous.matomo.org and the tracked data can be viewed there (the data is public). The collected data is used to improve Matomo. Thank you for making Matomo better!
row.introduction: Send anonmyized usage data to the creators of Matomo

row.name: ownPiwikSiteId
row.title: Site Id
row.description: If specified, anonymized usage data will be sent to the specified site in this Matomo.
row.introduction: Send anonymize usage data to this Matomo

row.name: customSiteUrl
row.title: Matomo Url
row.introduction: Send anonymize usage data to a custom Matomo

row.name: customSiteId
row.title: Site Id
row.description: If a URL and Site Id is specified, usage data will be sent to the custom Matomo instance.

row.name: useSentinelBackend
row.title: Enable Redis Sentinel'
row.inlineHelp: If enabled, the Redis Sentinel feature will be used. Make sure to update host and port if needed. Once you have enabled and saved the change, you will be able to specify multiple hosts and ports comma separated.

row.name: sentinelMasterName
row.title: Redis Sentinel Master name
row.inlineHelp: The sentinel master name only needs to be configured if Sentinel is enabled.

row.name: redisHost
row.title: Redis host or unix socket
row.inlineHelp: Remote host or unix socket of the Redis server. Max 500 characters are allowed.

row.name: redisPort
row.title: Redis port
row.inlineHelp: Port the Redis server is running on. Value should be between 1 and 65535. Use 0 if you are using unix socket to connect to Redis server.

row.name: redisDatabase
row.title: Redis database
row.inlineHelp: In case you are using Redis for caching make sure to use a different database.

row.name: redisPassword
row.title: Redis password
row.inlineHelp: Password set on the Redis server, if any. Redis can be instructed to require a password before allowing clients to execute commands.

row.name: queueEnabled
row.title: Queue enabled
row.inlineHelp: If enabled, all tracking requests will be written into a queue instead of the directly into the database. Requires a Redis server and phpredis PHP extension.

row.name: numQueueWorkers
row.title: Number of queue workers
row.inlineHelp: Number of allowed maximum queue workers. Accepts a number between 1 and 16. Best practice is to set the number of CPUs you want to make available for queue processing. Be aware you need to make sure to start the workers manually. We recommend to not use 9-15 workers, rather use 8 or 16 as the queue might not be distributed evenly into different queues. DO NOT USE more than 1 worker if you make use the UserId feature when tracking see https://github.com/piwik/piwik/issues/7691

row.name: numRequestsToProcess
row.title: Number of requests that are processed in one batch
row.inlineHelp: Defines how many requests will be picked out of the queue and processed at once. Enter a number which is >= 1.

row.name: processDuringTrackingRequest
row.title: Process during tracking request
row.inlineHelp: If enabled, we will process all requests within a queue during a normal tracking request once there are enough requests in the queue. This will not slow down the tracking request. If disabled, you have to setup a cronjob that executes the "./console queuedtracking:process" console command eg every minute to process the queue.
